candidates.title: Cut v0.3.0 release
candidates.body: Closes #192.

candidates.title: Upgrade to LDK v0.0.123
candidates.body: We bump LDK to v0.0.123 and `lightning-liquidity` to v0.1.0-alpha.4.

candidates.title: Improve on (potentially) blocking wallet behaviors
candidates.body:
~~Based on #141.~~

Due to our onchain wallet requiring us to hold a `Mutex` for the duration of the chain sync, many operations might be blocked for seconds at at time. 

Here, we make several changes that hopefully alleviate any blocking issues from holding the wallet lock(s). In particular we introduce a balance cache, drop our 'immediate retry sync' logic and drop the previous `wallet_lock` `Condvar` in favor of a pub/sub pattern that is beneficial in async runtime environments.

candidates.title: Improve connection management
candidates.body:
Based on #243.
Based on #244.

As a pre-factor to #256, we clean up our connection handling. Namely, we move it to a new `connection.rs` file and clean up the logic a bit, allowing us to drop the dependency on the `futures` crate.

Then, we introduce a `ConnectionManager` that handles pending connection attempts. Previously, concurrent calls to
`do_connect_peer`/`connect_peer_if_necessary` could result in multiple connections being opened, just to be closed as redundant shortly after. Here, we fix this behavior by ensuring only one connection attempt is inflight at any given point in time.

candidates.title: Bump `lightning-liquidity` to v0.1.0-alpha.1
candidates.body: .. which requires a few tiny changes due to things being moved around.

candidates.title: Upgrade to LDK v0.0.123-beta
candidates.body:
We're upgrading to LDK v0.0.122.

This is a WIP in progress PR and we'll incorporate more changes from `rust-lightning`'s `main` branch over time.

candidates.title: Upgrade UniFFI to 0.26.0
candidates.body: .. which notably features support for `async` methods and `non_exhaustive` enums.

candidates.title: Upgrade LDK to 0.0.121
candidates.body: .. as it was just released.

candidates.title: Add RetryPolicy to VssClient
candidates.body: * Add RetryPolicy to VssClient

candidates.title: Add Vss client side encryption using StorableBuilder
candidates.body: Add Vss client side encryption using StorableBuilder

candidates.title: Add support for liquidity mgmt. via `lightning-liquidity`
candidates.body:
Closes #194 

We add initial, alpha-stage support for liquidity-management via LSPS2/`lightning-liquidity`. 

Draft as still work in progress (and blocked on https://github.com/lightningdevkit/lightning-liquidity/pull/73 / https://github.com/lightningdevkit/lightning-liquidity/pull/74).

candidates.title: Make CI scripts more homogeneous
candidates.body: Since we now have a number of different integration tests (CLN, VSS), we move them all to the `tests` folder and align their naming scheme. As most of our Rust tests could also be considered blackbox/integration tests, we also move them from `functional_tests.rs` to `tests/integration_tests_rust.rs` to clean up our test directory structure.

candidates.title: Cut v0.2 release
candidates.body: We release LDK Node v0.2.

candidates.title: Upgrade to LDK 0.0.119
candidates.body: We upgrade LDK to 0.0.119, BDK to 0.29.0, and rust-bitcoin to 0.30, esplora-client to 0.6, etc.

candidates.title: Hide `vss-client` dependency behind `cfg` flag
candidates.body:
Fixes #197

Recently, we introduced first steps towards VSS support. Unfortunately, `vss-client` has a build dependency on blocking `reqwest` which defaults to use `native-tls`, pulling in `openssl-sys`, which in turn fails for the Android targets.

Here, we preliminarily hide the `vss-client` dependency behind the `cfg(vss)` flag to fix our Android builds.

candidates.title: Add integration tests with CLN
candidates.body: We add some integration testing against a CLN counterparty to our CI.

candidates.title: Allow GOSSIP logging and add more test utils
Upgrade to Uniffi 0.25
candidates.body: Parallel to https://github.com/bitcoindevkit/bdk-ffi/pull/414, we upgrade Uniffi to the newest version.

candidates.title: Fix `uniffi-bindgen` and Kotlin full cycle test
candidates.body:
Previously, we migrated to the cargo resolver 2, leading to `cli` feature not being available in the 'regular' dependency. Here we fix the build of `uniffi-bindgen` by moving the tool into its own binary crate.

Also, the full cycle test recently broke due to min HTLC value now being adjusted based on dust threshold. We therefore need to adjust the test case, just as we did previously in the Rust case.

candidates.title: Fix Android build
candidates.body:
Fixes #179 

Rust edition 2018 would include the dev-dependency `bitcoinconsensus` which broke during compilation of the Android targets.

Instead of figuring out if we can make it compile, we bump our crate edition, which won't include dev-dependencies in release builds, a win/win.

candidates.title: Fix build on Windows
candidates.body:
Since we're mostly there, might as well fix the build on Windows and include it in CI.

However, we don't actually run tests on Windows as our `electrsd` dependency doesn't build on it.

candidates.title: Add VSS Support in ldk-node
candidates.body:
Note: 
This PR does not add full support of VSS, there will be additional PR's for some of the changes. 
Currently it introduces only VssKVStore which is major chunk of code.

We will call it full support only once we make changes to public api for ldk-node.

Note on testing:
* Running a Java WAR file within a Rust test is not a straightforward process, as the execution of a Java WAR typically requires a Java runtime, which can not be natively managed by Rust.
* Currently it is tested against a local instance of VSS. But we will be testing this as part of our CI pipeline as discussed in sync, currently working on it.
* Alternative to env-var was feature-gate, but I didn't see much reason to introduce new feature for this test and it could be confusing. Setting env-var to any value will result in test-failure if vss doesn't work properly or it is not a correct endpoint. So we can easily verify this.

candidates.title: Upgrade to LDK 0.0.117
candidates.body:
~~Based on #105.~~

This is a draft PR which will be regularly rebased on upstream `HEAD` to incorporate and test the made changes.

candidates.title: Bump `esplora-client` and unpin BDK
candidates.body: This can only happen after `lightning-transaction-sync` bumped as well, so blocked on upstream for now.

candidates.title: Pin BDK to fix build
candidates.body: BDK 0.28.1 patch release upgraded the `esplora-client` dependency to 0.5, which is API incompatible with the 0.4 release we use in `lightning-transaction-sync`. In order to fix our builds, we pin BDK to the older version until we had a chance to upgrade `lightning-transaction-sync`.

candidates.title: chore: dont use chrono default features
candidates.body:
The `chrono` crate has a dependency on an old version of the `time` crate, which has a potential segfault: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/75556326/rust-segmentation-fault-in-chrono

I was attempting to use LDK Node in Fedimint and our crate audit flagged this dependency. Changing the `chrono` crate to not use the default features fixed it: https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/pull/2869

repo.name: ldk-node
repo.description: A ready-to-go node implementation built using LDK.
